meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sonorous.
meanings.sent1: The sonority of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I love the sonority of her voice when she sings.
meanings.sent3: The sonority of the dog's bark made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sonority of the orchestra filled the concert hall with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sonority of the wind chimes created a peaceful atmosphere in the garden.

meanings.definition: The relative loudness of a speech sound.
meanings.sent1: The teacher adjusted the sonority of the microphone for better clarity.
meanings.sent2: The sonority of his words made it difficult to ignore his message.
meanings.sent3: The sonority of the baby's cry startled the entire room.
meanings.sent4: The sonority of the thunder shook the windows of the house.
meanings.sent5: The sonority of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
